availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willis White (Hickman County, Kentucky, minister and county court judge)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, minister and county court judge. North Carolina native. Married to Harriet L. Richmond White. Father to Wilson W. White, Sarah White, Mary White, Thomas B. White, Robert T. White, Hattie B. White, and Mettie W. White. Minister in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Minister in Hickman County in 1860. Judge of Hickman County Court from 1862-1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 279B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 517.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 386B.
"Elder Willis White Dead," Hickman Courier, (Hickman, Ky.), Jan 23, 1891, p. 3.
"Willis White (1805-1891), Find A Grave, Memorial #63577358, accessed July 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63577358.
